tips.li: Mechs can adapt to EMP damage. Don't use it too much!
Traders usually keep their stash on their pack animals.
Generators produce a lot of heat--sometimes enough to give a colonist heatstroke.
Not all colonists need limbs. If needed, remove them.
Colonists can carry some medicine on them. This can be a lifesaver in tough moments.
Mountains can provide a shelter against heat and heatwaves.
Predators will not hunt a colonist that goes indoors.
The higher the quality of the bed, the faster people using it sleep.
People don't use all their organs. Removing unneccessary ones could turn a profit.
Many colonists can be researching at once, as long as each has a place to do so.
Human skin is a plentiful textile that can be used for many things, from couches to hats.
